intro: Genista holopetala, commonly known as the yellow broom or holopetala broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, spiny stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has small, trifoliate leaves and produces small, indehiscent pods that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
